abstract: When Neel T. Kashkari followed Henry Paulson Jr. from Goldman Sachs to Treasury in 2006, he had no idea that he’d eventually become the interim assistant secretary for financial stability. And when he was at Treasury, he had no idea he’d end up in the woods of Northern California.
snippet: When Neel T. Kashkari followed Henry Paulson Jr. from Goldman Sachs to Treasury in 2006, he had no idea that he’d eventually become the interim assistant secretary for financial stability. And when he was at Treasury, he had no idea he’d end up in...
lead_paragraph: When Neel T. Kashkari followed Henry Paulson Jr. from Goldman Sachs to the Treasury Department in 2006, he had no idea that he’d eventually become the interim assistant secretary for financial stability, in charge of putting together a $700 billion bailout to save the financial system from total collapse.
